event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Check ambient temperatures in the environment.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: A thermal sensor is above the high failure threshold in an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
This message indicates that temperatures with a FRU have reached temperatures requiring that the OS be shut down to protect components and data integrity. The PSU's will shut themselves off if a critical overtemp is encountered. Overtemps in other FRU's will cause the fan speed to increase in the PSU's but will not power them off. If both PSU's go overtemp they will both shut down causing the unit to be completely off.

In general this fault is related to a rise in the ambient temperature of the surrounding environment.

1) Ensure the ambient temperature of your system is within the recommended range. Run the ioxadm command, as shown below, to get a full report of the current temperature values.

Example:

LEGEND:
RED = SUNW-MSG-ID
BLUE = EVENT_ID
GREEN = FRU

XSCF> ioxadm -v env
  Location     Sensor    Min Min Alarm Value Max Alarm Max   Units
  IOX@X031     ACTIVE    -        -      On      -     -     LED
  IOX@X031     LOCATE    -        -      Off     -     -     LED
  IOX@X031     OVERTEMP  -        -      Off     -     -     LED
  IOX@X031     SERVICE   -        -      Off     -     -     LED
  IOX@X031/PS0 DCOK      -        -      On      -     -     LED
  IOX@X031/PS0 POWER     -        -      On      -     -     LED
  IOX@X031/PS0 RDY2RM    -        -      Off     -     -     LED
  IOX@X031/PS0 SERVICE   -        -      Off     -     -     LED
  IOX@X031/PS0 T_AMBIENT -128.000 -    26.000 37.000 127.000 C
  IOX@X031/PS0 T_CHIP    -128.000 -    27.000 37.000 127.000 C
  IOX@X031/PS0 T_HOTSPOT -128.000 -    29.000 90.000 127.000 C
  IOX@X031/PS0 SWITCH    -        -      On      -     -     SWITCH
  ...

2) Ensure there are no blockages of the air intakes at the front of the unit.

3) Ensure there are no existing Fan faults.

Step 1: Collect the fault message.
A single line fault message is displayed to the system console and logged in the /var/logs/message file. The complete message may be retrieved by using the 'fmdump' command on the XSCF console as shown below.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -m
   MSG-ID: IOXSCF-8000-P3, TYPE: Fault, VER: 1, SEVERITY: Critical
   EVENT-TIME: Tue Mar 27 07:21:50 PDT 2007
   PLATFORM: SPARC-Enterprise, CSN: BE80601000, HOSTNAME: server-0
   SOURCE: sde, REV: 1.12
   EVENT-ID: 6f038a30-52bd-4136-a7de-00b46f64c16a
   DESC: A thermal sensor is above the high failure threshold in an External I/O Expansion Unit FRU
   Refer to %FMAURL%/IOXSCF-8000-P3 for more information.
   AUTO-RESPONSE: The affected hardware may be powered off.
   IMPACT: Domains using the hardware may panic if hardware is powered off.
   REC-ACTION: Check ambient temperatures in the environment.

Step 2: Collect the "fmdump" output.
Use the fmdump command with the Event-ID option to retrieve more information on the fault which has occurred.

Example:

XSCF> fmdump -vu 6f038a30-52bd-4136-a7de-00b46f64c16a
   TIME                 UUID                                 MSG-ID
   Mar 27 07:21:50.8921 6f038a30-52bd-4136-a7de-00b46f64c16a IOXSCF-8000-P3
       100% fault.chassis.iox.env.temp.over-fail
       Problem in: hc:///iox=983392/iob=0/thermctrl=0/t_hotspot=0
          Affects: -
              FRU: hc://:product-id=SPARC-Enterprise:chassisid=BE80601000:server-id=server-
0:serial=XE008L:part=5016939:revision=04/component=IOX@X031/IOB0

Step 3: Provide the output collected to your service provider.
If the above steps have not alleviated your problem contact your Authorized Service Provider and provide the information collected in the steps above.
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Domains using the hardware may panic if hardware is powered off.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: The affected hardware may be powered off.
event_registry_properties.name: title
